title.native: メイドインアビス 深き魂の黎明
title.romaji: Made in Abyss: Fukaki Tamashii no Reimei
title.english: Made in Abyss: Dawn of the Deep Soul

description:
Dawn of the Deep Soul continues the epic adventure of plucky Riko and Reg who are joined by their new friend Nanachi. Together they descend into the Abyss’ treacherous fifth layer, the Sea of Corpses, and encounter the mysterious Bondrewd, a legendary White Whistle whose shadow looms over Nanachi’s troubled past. Bondrewd is ingratiatingly hospitable, but the brave adventurers know things are not always as they seem in the enigmatic Abyss...

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: Made in Abyss: Dawn of a Deep Soul

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Dungeon
tags.description: Prominently features a dungeon environment.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Amputation
tags.description: Features amputation or amputees.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1522114648098619397)

He grew up admiring anime such as [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/) an during highschool he started animating with his friends. He enrolled into a professional animation school after graduating but quit quickly due to being disappointed in how the lessons were conducted.

He joined Anime R and later its subsidiary Studio Muu. His first work was as an in-betweener on [Psycho Armor Govarian](https://anilist.co/anime/6428/) while his debut as a key animator was on [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/anime/2116/).

After working on [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/)'s [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1095/) he permanently joined Production I.G. becoming known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

He's is one of the most prominent animators of the realist school, with emphasis on solid shapes and weighty character animation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/小島正幸) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masayuki_Kojima)

Originating from Kaname Production, currently affiliated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/).

Known for directing shows such as [Monster](https://anilist.co/anime/19/), [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/) and [Hanada Shounen-shi](https://anilist.co/anime/2004/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/124182562)

An extremely prolific animator often appearing in dozens of shows yearly.

Affiliated with [Studio Silver](https://anilist.co/studio/6240/). Older brother of [You Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/).

He is known for having reached great expertise in many techniques from realistic animation to digital compositing. This gives him the ability to have full control over his works, often being responsible for the key frames, in-betweens, finishing, photography and backgrounds of the scenes he is in charge of.

His skilled use of coloring and compositing, together with the realistic depiction of movement make his works to be often mistaken for computer generated animation.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Ghost in the Shell (Video Game, 1997) (OP Key Animation)
- Tales of Phantasia (Video Game, 1998) (Cutscene Director, Animation Director, Key Animation)
- Valkyrie Profile Series (Video Game, 1999-2008) (Character Design, Art Design) 
- Kafu ~Kono Shirabe ga Kimi ni Todokimasu You ni~ (Visual Novel, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography, CG Animation)
- Sakura Wars 3: Paris is Burning? (Video Game, 2001) (OP Key Animation, In-Between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Akiiro Renka (Visual Novel, 2005) (OP Director, Animation Character Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography)
- Muv-Luv Alternative (Visual Novel, 2006) (Cutscene Mecha Design, Key Animation, In-between Animation, Background Art, Digital Paint, Photography) !~
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.
A former Studio Easter employee. Debuted as an art director on [Guin Saga](https://anilist.co/anime/5041/).

__Origin:__ Perth, Australia
__Alma Mater:__ Royal College of Music (2015)

[Website](https://www.kpenkmusic.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kevinpenkin) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kevinpenkincomposer) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kpenkin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD05wgzXUYvA7rIE3XGfFFg) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/kevinpenkin) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Penkin)

An Australian anime composer and video game composer. He is best known for composing the award-winning score to the anime [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/).

Penkin grew up in Perth, Australia. His interest in game music came from listening to the "Phendrana Drifts" theme from Metroid Prime; in a 2012 interview, he referred to the theme's electronic synths and acoustic instruments as "absolute bliss." Penkin began his career with composition credits in the 2011 short films Play Lunch and The Adventures of Chipman and Biscuit Boy. In the same year, Penkin composed the soundtrack of the video game Jūzaengi: Engetsu Sangokuden; this soundtrack represented Penkin's first collaboration with [Nobuo Uematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100150). Penkin has continued to collaborate with Uematsu in titles such as Norn9 and Defender’s Quest II: Mists of Ruin.

In 2015, Penkin graduated from the Royal College of Music with a Master's degree in Composition for Screen. In 2016, Penkin collaborated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/) on the [Norn9](https://anilist.co/anime/20643/) anime and the [Under the Dog](https://anilist.co/anime/21002/) original video animation soundtracks. Penkin's relationship with Kinema Citrus continued through to 2017 for the soundtrack of [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/), winning the 2017 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it. In 2018, Penkin composed the score for the video game Florence. Penkin composed the music for Kinema Citrus' adaptation of [The Rising of the Shield Hero](https://anilist.co/anime/99263/) and NetEase's VR game Nostos in 2019. Penkin most recently composed the music for the 2020 anime adaptation of the South Korean webtoon [Tower of God](https://anilist.co/anime/115230/), winning the 2021 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it.

He used to live in the United Kingdom, but currently resides in Melbourne, Australia.

MYTH & ROID is a musical unit consisting of music producer [Tom-H@ck](https://anilist.co/staff/107596/Tomohiro-Oshima), lyricist [hotaru](https://anilist.co/staff/150361/hotaru), and vocalist [KIHOW](https://anilist.co/staff/220691/). In 2017, the original vocalist, Mayu Maeshima, left the unit and was replaced by KIHOW.
